These are the major site security measures:



?    Six-foot minimum height chain-link fence surrounds the site

?    Guard house at main entrance staffed with a security guard 7AM-4PM M-F

?    The Plant is staffed 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

?    All other gates are locked but may be opened in the event of emergency egress from the inside.

?    Warning signs



It is the policy of FirstEnergy to assure the safe operation of the facility which is designed and built to good engineering practices that incorporate methods or principles in accordance with applicable industry standards.  Some of these standards include ASME Code for Power Piping, B31.1, and ASME Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code, Section VIII.   



Five Year Accident History



There have been no reportable accidents in the past five years.  



Emergency Response



There is a written emergency response plan that is coordinated with the Allegheny County Health Department, the Springdale LEPC and the local fire departments.  Selected site response personnel are HAZWOPER trained.    



Emergency response planning has long been an integral part of operations at Springdale.  Regulations under OSHA, EPA, and PADEP have required the site to develop and implement procedures to plan for and respond to emergency situations at the plant whether due to natural disasters, storms, chemical release exposure or harm/damage resulting from potentially flammable or explosive materials.  



The RMP Emergency Response Plan includes the following sections:

1.0    Facility Description

2.0    Emergency Response Plan Organization 

3.0    Emergency Coordinators

Planned Changes to Improve Safety



As a result of the Process Hazard Analysis and Off-site Consequence Analysis the following changes were implemented:

? Included a section in the Emergency Response Program to shut down the Control Room HVAC system in the event of an ammonia release.

? Installation of ammonia detectors in the vicinity of the ammonia storage and unloading area and each SCR skid with visual and audio alarms for a 50 ppm concentration action level.

? Installation of bollards where ammonia pipeline travels underground and emerges aboveground to prevent pipeline impacts.

? Painting and installation of signage which labels the underground ammonia pipeline.

? Purchased and supplied additional escape air canisters in the Control Room and ammonia unloading area.

? Installation of a wind sock for instantaneous determination of wind direction for emergency planning purposes.
